bullets.text: U.S. PPI for final demand rose 0.5% in December; services +0.7% while goods were flat, signaling sticky pipeline inflation pressures.
Trump nominates Kevin Warsh for Fed chair, injecting uncertainty about the future rate path and perceived Fed independence; markets and bonds stayed unsettled.
Senate passed a funding deal, but a partial U.S. government shutdown still looms, risking disruption to federal services, payments, and some data releases.
Silver plunged about 30% in its worst day since 1980 and gold fell, highlighting extreme commodity volatility tied to shifting rate expectations and dollar strength.
Oil prices notched the first monthly gain in six months, putting OPEC+ strategy and supply discipline back in focus for near-term price direction.
U.N. warns it is nearing financial collapse due to unpaid member dues, threatening peacekeeping capacity and humanitarian operations.
Iran rules out talks with the U.S. until Trump’s threats stop, raising escalation risks that could spill into regional stability and energy markets.
A Panama Canal-related ruling strengthens U.S. leverage in the U.S.-China strategic infrastructure contest, with potential knock-on effects for shipping and investment flows.
Eli Lilly plans a $3.5B Pennsylvania manufacturing plant for next-generation obesity injections, expanding U.S. capacity and reinforcing expectations of sustained GLP-1 demand.
Lilly CEO says Medicare coverage for obesity drugs could be a major catalyst, expanding the addressable market while intensifying debates over federal health spending.
A former Google engineer was found guilty of AI-tech espionage and theft, underscoring tighter U.S. enforcement and rising geopolitical risk around advanced semiconductors and models.
Google disrupted a large residential proxy network; separately, 175k+ publicly exposed Ollama AI instances were reported—highlighting growing cyber risk in AI infrastructure.
